decks.notes: The main concept of this deck revolves around the combo between Splinter Twin and Deceiver Exarch to create an infinite number of hasty token creatures. The deck includes various interactive spells like counterspells, removal, and card draw to protect the combo and control the game. It also has cards like Pestermite and Vendilion Clique that can be used as additional combo pieces or disrupt the opponent's strategy. The mana base is designed to support the deck's spells and includes fetch lands to improve consistency and fix mana colors.

The deck revolves around utilizing the Amulet of Vigor to generate explosive mana and ramp into Primeval Titan. With the combination of bounce lands, Gemstone Mine, and Amulet of Vigor, the deck is able to play multiple lands per turn and potentially cast Primeval Titan on turn three. The deck also includes the combo of Hive Mind and Pact spells to force opponents into tricky situations. Overall, the key concept of the deck is to quickly assemble the necessary pieces for the Amulet Titan combo and overwhelm opponents with powerful threats.

This deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent early with aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf, Siege Rhino, and Lingering Souls, while controlling the board with removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Thoughtseize. Liliana of the Veil provides disruption while also generating card advantage. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying threats that can quickly end the game. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements while also providing some utility lands for added flexibility. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and disruption.

The main theme of this deck is to assemble the Twin Exarch combo as quickly and efficiently as possible. The deck includes cards like Snapcaster Mage, Deceiver Exarch, and Pestermite to generate infinite tokens with Splinter Twin. It also includes control elements like Remand, Mana Leak, and Cryptic Command to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, the deck utilizes cards like Lightning Bolt and Blood Moon to control the board and slow down the opponent's game plan. The mana base is optimized for consistency and to support the various colors needed for the combo.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient creature threats. It aims to establish early board presence with mana acceleration from Noble Hierarch and Birds of Paradise, while also benefiting from creatures like Voice of Resurgence and Kitchen Finks that generate additional value when they die. The deck then progresses into larger threats like Siege Rhino and Wilt-Leaf Liege to continue applying pressure. Lingering Souls provides additional flying creatures and tokens, while Gavony Township helps to pump up the team. Removal spells like Path to Exile and Thoughtseize assist in disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The key concept of this deck is to play aggressively with a mix of powerful creatures, removal spells, and disruption. By utilizing efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf, Siege Rhino, and Tasigur, along with support from cards like Lingering Souls and Noble Hierarch, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly. Additionally, the inclusion of hand disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Path to Exile helps control the game and clear the path for victory. The deck's mana base is carefully crafted to support its aggressive game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to apply constant pressure on the opponent by playing aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, while also dealing direct damage with burn spells like Lava Spike, Lightning Bolt, and Boros Charm. The deck aims to control the game tempo and finish off the opponent quickly before they have a chance to stabilize. Using efficient spells and creatures, this deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent and win the game through fast and relentless aggression.

The key concept of this Aggro Red Deck Wins deck is to deal quick and consistent damage to the opponent using efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Rift Bolt. This strategy is supported by aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide, Monastery Swiftspear, and Eidolon of the Great Revel to pressure the opponent early on. The deck also includes cards like Boros Charm and Skullcrack to protect against lifegain and disruption. The mana base is carefully constructed to provide the right colors for the spells while maintaining speed and consistency in the deck's overall game plan.

This Modern 1 vs 1 Aggro - Affinity deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of artifact creatures supported by cards like Arcbound Ravager and Steel Overseer. By playing efficient low-cost creatures like Vault Skirge and Ornithopter, and using equipment like Cranial Plating, the deck aims to deal fast and consistent damage. The artifact lands and Mox Opal provide mana acceleration, while Welding Jar and Etched Champion offer protection against removal spells. The inclusion of Galvanic Blast and Thoughtcast ensures both removal and card draw to maintain tempo and pressure on the opponent.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent, utilizing aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear along with efficient burn spells like Lava Spike and Lightning Bolt. The main goal is to apply pressure early on and continue to chip away at the opponent's life total while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel. By using a mix of creatures and burn spells, this deck aims to close out the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize or mount a defense.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly build up infect counters on your opponent's creature to win the game. The deck includes various pump spells like Might of Old Krosa and Mutagenic Growth to boost the power of your infect creatures, as well as protection spells like Vines of Vastwood and Apostle's Blessing to ensure your creatures can connect. Wild Defiance provides additional support by increasing the power of your spells, making it essential to the overall strategy of the deck. This deck aims to win as quickly as possible through infect damage.

This deck focuses on quickly playing powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf, Siege Rhino, and Tasigur, while disrupting the opponent with discard spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. Liliana of the Veil provides additional disruption and removal, while Lingering Souls can generate extra creatures. The deck also includes versatile removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Path to Exile. The mana base is designed to support all the colors necessary for the deck's spells, and includes creature lands like Treetop Village for additional aggression. This deck aims to apply pressure early and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the Amulet of Vigor card in combination with bounce lands and extra land play abilities to ramp up mana quickly and efficiently. The goal is to get a Primeval Titan onto the battlefield as soon as possible, allowing for massive land searches and powerful combos. Other key cards such as Hive Mind and Summoner's Pact provide additional support and win conditions. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with huge creatures and game-winning plays within just a few turns.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the Amulet of Vigor with the Titan lands to generate a large amount of mana quickly and easily. This enables the player to cast Primeval Titan and search for more lands or utility lands to further advance their game plan. The deck also utilizes Hive Mind as a finisher with Summoner's Pact, forcing the opponent to either lose the game or find a way to deal with the enchantment. The combination of ramp, land untapping effects, and powerful land tutors make this deck a formidable combo threat in Modern format.

The deck focuses on dealing quick and direct damage to the opponent through efficient burn spells and hasty creatures, while also disrupting their game plan with cards that prevent lifegain and punish non-creature spells. It aims to end the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize or gain too much life. The mana base is optimized to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors for casting spells.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. This allows the player to cast powerful colorless spells such as Karn Liberated and Wurmcoil Engine. The deck focuses on controlling the board with removal spells like Pyroclasm and Oblivion Stone while also using card selection and mana fixing with cards like Ancient Stirrings and Sylvan Scrying. The deck also includes some powerful threats like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn to close out games quickly.

The primary focus of this deck is to quickly deal 10 poison counters to the opponent by utilizing powerful pump spells and evasion abilities on infect creatures like Glistener Elf and Blighted Agent. The deck includes efficient mana ramp with creatures like Noble Hierarch, protection spells like Spellskite and Apostle's Blessing, and buffs like Wild Defiance to ensure the infect creatures can deal lethal damage. By maximizing the use of infect and combo potential, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents and win the game in a few quick turns.

The primary focus of this deck is to quickly and efficiently deal lethal poison damage to the opponent using the infect mechanic. By playing low-cost infect creatures like Glistener Elf and Blighted Agent, combined with pump spells like Mutagenic Growth and Become Immense, the deck aims to win the game before the opponent can establish their own board presence. Protection spells like Vines of Vastwood and Apostle's Blessing help ensure the infect creatures can connect with the opponent, while cards like Noble Hierarch provide additional mana ramp to power out the combo pieces.

This deck is focused on using quick, evasive creatures with the Infect ability to deal damage directly to the opponent's life total. By combining creatures like Glistener Elf and Blighted Agent with pump spells like Groundswell and Mutagenic Growth, the deck aims to poison the opponent as quickly as possible. Protection spells like Apostle's Blessing and Vines of Vastwood help to protect the combo pieces, while cards like Wild Defiance help to increase the potency of the pump spells. Inkmoth Nexus provides an alternate win condition by turning into a creature with Infect.

The main concept of this Jund Aggro deck is to apply early pressure with efficient threats like Tarmogoyf and Tasigur while disrupting the opponent's game plan with hand disruption like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. The deck also features versatile removal spells like Lightning Bolt, Abrupt Decay, and Terminate to deal with opposing threats. The mana base is optimized for consistency and includes utility lands like Raging Ravine and Tectonic Edge. The deck aims to control the board and win through a mix of aggression and disruption in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This Aggro deck focuses on quickly bringing out powerful creatures such as Siege Rhino and Tarmogoyf to apply pressure to the opponent. The deck also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, cards like Liliana of the Veil and Lingering Souls provide additional value and control elements. The mana base is built around a mix of fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent mana fixing. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of aggressive threats and disruptive spells.

This deck focuses on creating a fast and aggressive board presence with creatures like Birds of Paradise, Voice of Resurgence, and Loxodon Smiter. It also utilizes disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Path to Exile to control the opponent's plays. Wilt-Leaf Liege and Lingering Souls provide additional value and token generation, while Siege Rhino serves as a powerful finisher. Gavony Township can help pump up your creatures and close out the game quickly. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure consistent and efficient color fixing for the deck's requirements.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize the Cascade mechanic to cast Living End, a powerful sorcery that can clear the board of all creatures and return all creatures from the graveyard onto the battlefield. The deck includes a mix of creatures with the cycling ability, such as Monstrous Carabid and Deadshot Minotaur, in order to trigger cascade effects and dig through the deck. Additionally, the deck includes disruptive cards like Fulminator Mage and Beast Within to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The land base is constructed to support the deck's color requirements while also providing additional utility.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent's life total by playing efficient and aggressive creatures. The deck focuses on having a diverse and powerful creature base, including Wild Nacatl, Tarmogoyf, Geist of Saint Traft, and Siege Rhino. The deck also incorporates a splash of tribal synergy through Tribal Flames. The deck is supported by a strong removal suite in Lightning Bolt, Abrupt Decay, and Path to Exile, allowing it to clear the way for its creatures to attack. The mana base is designed to support all the colors required for the deck's diverse creature base and spells.
